vsParam: Is this a newly discovered relic? Hmm. You're analyzing it...
It's hard to analyze it at this stage. But... Look here...
Hey. Ryza. Why are you staring at Anise?
Oh. Hmm... Relic...? I'm looking at that relic.
You're interested in relics? Why, Ryza?
A sage must pay attention to the surroundings.
By the way, could you tell me why you're interested in relics?

Are you simply interested in the unknown past...
But you don't strike me as someone like that.

Hmm... Many people think that I don't like study...
Er. To some extent they're right.

No. Here's the thing...
That relic looks like something from the place I used to live.

Huh? Relics are heritages from ancient civilizations. Many
features they have can't be reproduced by modern technology.
Ryza, does this relic resemble something... in your world?
Yes. They are called "Ancient Tools" in the place I come from.

Like you just mentioned, they are tools made by
ancient people, and these tools are quite efficient.

Uh~ It's quite interesting that similar things also exist in
other worlds.

No, on second thought, that's only natural. The essence of
civilizations is something that flourishes and withers again and again.

It means that most civilizations are rooted in
"prehistoric civilizations". So...
This explains the coexistence of "relics" and "ancient tools"...

So perhaps... The tools we made will become "relics" or
"ancient tools" in the future!

Ha ha. That is possible.
And it ever happens, it should happen in the distant future.

Uh! Heehee. This is quite interesting. No matter it's a "relic"
or an "ancient tool", it must be made by someone, right?

Maybe the person who made it was thinking, "just make it,
and leave it to the future generations!"
Yeah. In this sense, it sounds so romantic.

Although it's not easy, we should work hard to make sure
that our tools can be passed down to future civilizations.
I'll strive to be an outstanding alchemist! Heehee...
Hmm. Although I couldn't know how those who made the "relics" felt...
These relics might be made with a lot of passion.
